definition: oracle bone/bone used for divination, esp. animal scapula
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
tortoise shell and animal bones used in divination/oracle bone inscriptions (an early form of Chinese script)
oracle inscriptions of the Shang Dynasty (16th-11th century BC) on tortoiseshells or animal bones
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
oracle script/oracle bone character (an early form of Chinese script)
ancient ceramic three-legged vessel used for cooking with cord markings on the outside and hollow legs
Yinxu, ruins of Yinshang 殷商 city at Anyang 安陽|安阳 in Henan province, a World Heritage site
ancient bronze food vessel with a round mouth and two or four handles/round basket of bamboo
